data.title: Delicious Montana Mexican
data.text: Jalisco is a great spot for quality Mexican food in Great Falls - enchiladas, chile verde, chicken burrito and chile rellenos are all top notch and they have a great selection and price on domestic, international and craft beer. Their special dish is molcajete, which smelled heavenly. The staff are also among the most attentive and courteous I've been around.

data.title: Excellent Food & Service
data.text: We often have lunch and dinner at Fiesta en Jalisco, and it is by far one of the best Mexican Restaurants around.  Always fast service, and very good food, especially the carne asada.

data.title: Good Mexican
data.text: Good food, good margaritas,  good service, nice decor. The salsa with the chips has nice heat, and great flavor. I had shrimp in a wine sauce that was delicious, my husband really enjoyed his burrito. The service was prompt and cheerful. We would eat here again.

data.title: Service OK but the food is not worth it
data.text: We went tonight and that has to be some of the worst Tex-Mex food we have ever had. The chips were small and broken, the salsa looked like it was chopped with a hatchet, the Queso came from a can, and the enchiladas were just rolled up meat in a tortilla with some cheese melted on top.  The rice was crunchy and the beans also tasted as if they were warned from a can.  I can not recommend this establishment to anyone.

data.title: Great food great price
data.text:
Super large portions with a varied menu this include mole. The half carafe of wine for $6.25 contained three full glasses. Good wasn't spicy so if that is your thing just get extra hot sauce on the side. 

Nice atmosphere with current Hispanic music playing just a bit too loud. 

A good choice for Mexican food

data.title: Good
data.text: Average Mexican restaurant. Service was not the best. Food quality is a medium at best. Nothing was wrong but at the same time nothing great

data.title: Visited with our impatient toddler
data.text: This was one restaurant that did not offer coloring paper (which seems to be somewhat common these days) but we were ready with a few books! The food arrived shockingly fast and was good.

data.title: Ole!
data.text: My tried and true favorite is the Verde Burrito & never let's me down. We were also very impressed by the Colorado burrito -- the meat was seasoned really well--a great balance of chili and supplemental seasoning.

data.title: Not for me
data.text: Went there for lunch. Fingerprints all over the door are never a good sign for me. Seated immediately. Chips and salsa good. Iced tea tasted fresh brewed. I ordered the shredded beef enchilada with salad. There was probably two tablespoons of meat. The tortilla was fried until just barely golden, then a thin sauce (had the appearance of the liquid in the bottom of a can of chopped tomatoes).  Result was a totally soggy tortilla. I didn't eat it. The salad was prepackaged thin cut lettuce and purple cabbage and tomato. My husband ordered the beef enchilada and taco with rice and beans. He said it was decent. He didn't care for the rice, too bland. Service was good. I'd try the other places in town before returning.

data.title: Great Mexican Food!
data.text: This the ONLY place to go in Great Falls for good Mexican food. The menu is stacked with great selections. The portion sizes are huge, and the quality is exceptional. Good friendly service. We never miss a chance to eat here!

data.title: Authentic
data.text: Best pollo de crema in town.  Always polite service, plenty of food, you won't want alway hungry.  I would go so far as to say it is the best Mexican restaurant in Great Falls.

data.title: Decent
data.text: It's in a good location, it depends on the cook. Sometimes the same, flavor or portions other times different. Service is mediocre, it is med/pricey.

data.title: Asada Burrito
data.text:
The Asada Burrito here is pretty good. Pieces of grilled flank steak, beans, rice, onions and peppers topped with sour cream and guacamole. The chips were nice and warm as well and the salsa had a great balance of chunk and liquid. 

Service was a tad on the slow side but not unexpected for being in Central MT. All in all, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

data.title: Really Tasty! Festive decor! Good value!
data.text: We were craving really good Mexican food and this really filled the bill! Authentic atmosphere! Good, fast and friendly service! Tasty margaritas! Excellent food! Lots of it! The shredded beef burrito was sooooo good and huge...for $10 bucks! Fast! Great price!

data.title: Very good food, fast out of the kitchen!
data.text: Had fun here. Awesome margaritas, good authentic food, and a cheerful server. I recommend it, even though it is attached to a casino, you'd never know it.

data.title: Large Portions
data.text: The Steak special(#43) was large and too much for me. My partner had a combo and couldn't finish the portion because it was too much food for her. Both were tasty and nearly authentic made with fresh ingredients. Service was courteous and prompt.

data.title: Dinner at Fiesta en Jalisco
data.text: We went to Fiesta en Jalisco during our stay in Great Falls. Thats a basic mexican restaurant and basically arranged. We were waiting some minutes even if the restaurant seemed completely empty. The waitress seemed to be a little bit unorganized. We waited long time for chips and salsa to come out. We had a quesadilla and steak fajitas which were ok, but nothing special. All over the food was average. Next time we would check for an alternative!

data.title: Everything is delicious......I would be happy with just the chips and salsa
data.text: I love this place!!!!! It is authentic, great service/staff, decent price and I will definitely come back every time in Great Falls. I love Mexican food and this satisfies my craving for it. The chips and salsa are awesome. The servings are huge.

data.title: Best Mex for Miles!
data.text: Their Horchata is delicious. I have been here numerous times and have been pleased with real Mexican food (hard to come by up north!).  I've had Mexican food in Mexico and California and numerous other places that are a lot more Mexican than Montana, and this restaurant lives up to it's claim as serving authentic Mexican Food. Everything I've had here has been superb!

data.title: Go to Montana to get better Mexican food than in Texas
data.text: OMG I couldn't believe this place!  Excellent prices, especially on the drinks!  This mexican food tasted better than any I've had in Texas in 10 years!  The salsa was to die for!  It has a kick, but not so hot that you can't enjoy it.  It's made fresh.  I ordered two cups to go!!  Did I say it was great?  The service was also great.  We loved it so much we took the bride and groom and wedding party there the day we left.
